fields.description:
Often on a large pull request where some refactoring change has been made and many files are touched, most of the files touched fall into the category of "not needing review". The actual meaningful change in the pull request occurs in a small number of key files. It would be great if Bitbucket gave the PR author the choice to select which files are "meaningful" to review in a pull request in this state.

On a normal pull request, when you can view all the files, an author can choose to highlight certain changes with a comment. But on a "too many files" PR, the author can't even necessarily scroll to the correct file to add a comment, hinting where reviewers should actually look.
fields.summary: When a pull request has too many files, allow the pull request author to manually select which files to display by default

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A high number of REST API requests can potentially have an impact on the overall performance of Bitbucket.

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduced a rate limit or a throttling mechanism to avoid any impact on performance.

h3. Workaround
Implement a rate limit on the load balancer in front of Bitbucket.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would a way to limit the number of requests that reach Bitbucket Server to prevent the performance to be impacted by a significant number of requests

fields.description:
Bitbucket's branch permissions operate in a case-insensitive manner (as implemented in BSERV-3997) but the UI does not reflect this.

For example, one of our repositories has restrictions to only allow changes via Pull Request to the "dev" branch. One of the developers created a "Dev" branch (upper-case "D"), but was then unable to push to it. Bitbucket's branch permission view showed us that it wasn't aware of the branch as far as permissions were concerned:

!image-2018-10-05-11-43-04-033.png!

To avoid confusion, it would be ideal if Bitbucket's UI reflected the case-insensitive behavior of branch permissions in some fashion, especially since branches with the same names but differing in case is allowed.

 

*Edit:* Since my image didn't seem to attach, the repository branch permissions view shows "dev [NOT FOUND]" after creating the "Dev" branch.
fields.summary: Bitbucket UI does not reflect case sensitivity behavior for branch names

fields.description:
Per [Bitbucket Server Documentation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/alldoc/bitbucket-server-documentation-directory-278071997.html/], downloadable XML Exports of the Bitbucket Server is available on request.

As of Bitbucket Server 5.x, the XML Exports are no longer being produced.

Suggested Solution
Continue offering XML Exports for Bitbucket Server 5.x.
fields.summary: Create XML Export of Local Documentation for Bitbucket 5.14

fields.description:
When opening a random repository there's the possibility of creating a new branch. Upon doing so, a search box appears that is able to search for existing repositories, but not projects.
Apart search for repositories, it would be useful to be able to search for projects too.
fields.summary: Ability to search for projects when creating branches

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

It's not possible to view, and add in-line comments in pull requests on IE11

This issue occurs only on Internet Explorer 11, works fine on other browsers, Firefox, Chrome, Safari

Environment:
Internet Explorer 11
Bitbucket Server 5.14
fields.summary: In-line comments on pull requests are broken on IE11

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Mirrors can receive many concurrent ref advertisement requests (mainly by CI/CD tools).
These requests will lead to scm tickets being consumed very quickly and operations to being queued.
In some extreme cases, this could even lead to operations not being performed at all when the timeouts are hit.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable the "Ref advertisement caching" by default on mirrors

h3. Workaround
In the interim, enable the ref advertisement cache by adding the following to the {{bitbucket.properties}} file for each mirror:
{noformat}
plugin.bitbucket-scm-cache.refs.enabled=true
{noformat}

+Note+
no plugins can be installed on mirrors so the refs will always be in the expected status in the caches because. There is no risk that a plugin will manipulate the refs without the caching plugin detecting these changes.

+Note 2+
It is not possible to set or check the status of the ref cache by using REST API endpoints on the mirror.
fields.summary: Enable Ref advertisement caching by default on mirrors

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating branch from a Jira issue, if the Jira Summary issue is too long (more than 100 characters), the shortened branch name that is suggested which is shorten is still too long. E.g, for a Jira issue (type story): 

Jira Issue Summary: "123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789" (149 characters)

Suggested branch name: RTA-5066-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789 (98 characters)

Suggested prefix: "feature/" (8 characters)

That makes a total length of the suggested branch name of 106, more than the 100 characters allowed for a branch name

This bug will also then lead to the following bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-10433

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Jira issue with a long summary (E.g: 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789)
# From the issue page, click 'Create branch', this should redirect to the create branch page on Bitbucket Server
# On the branch create page, click 'Create' without changing anything (using the suggested branch name and prefix)

h3. Expected Results
Users are able to create a branch on Bitbucket with the suggested branch name

h3. Actual Results
Users won't be able create a branch on Bitbucket with the suggested branch name. Instead, they get the error message "The ref name, once fully qualified, is limited to 100 characters", without any possibility to change the branch name. 

 !lVmhCCSHlq.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira "Create branch" feature creates branch name which is too long for Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Enabling debug log on a Bitbucket Server mirror requires:
- to add the logging class to the {{bitbucket.properties}} file - see [Troubleshooting Smart Mirroring|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/troubleshooting-smart-mirroring-838407670.html]
- restart Bitbucket

Restarting a mirror to enable debug could lead to the following:
- the mirror not being available with no redundancy option
- the issue to be resolved by a restart with no possibility to use the additional logging for troubleshooting


h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the possibility to enable additional logging on the mirror without the need for a restart. For example:
- REST API endpoint
- User interface (BSERV-9595)

This should also cover profiling.

h3. Workaround
Not available.
fields.summary: Enable additional logging on the mirror without the need for a restart

fields.description: Navigating to the "webhooks" section of the Bitbucket server documentation ([https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/5.14.0/bitbucket-rest.html#idm46783598031088\|https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/5.14.0/bitbucket-rest.html#idm46783598031088]), under the POST section, the "expand" test for the "Example request representations" does not reveal the example.
fields.summary: Webhooks REST documentation request example does not expand

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We have Pull Requests with multiple reviewers. Consider the following scenario that frequently occurs to us:
 # Reviewer1 (R1) opens a Pull Request (PR)
 # Reviewer2 (R2) opens the same PR
 # R1 adds a comment to the PR
 # While R2 is not aware of the comment that has just been added by R1, he adds his own comment, that is not aligned with the previous one
 # The PR ends up with comments that are out of sync.

This does not facilitate the level of team collaboration we would like to achieve.
h3. Suggested Solution

When R1 saves his comment, R2 should see an instant notification on his screen, that would prompt him to reload the page in order to see the change. This would be similar to [Workbox Notifications in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/workbox-notifications-284365963.html].
h3. Why this is important

It would greatly improve the collaboration between different players involved in the Pull Requests.
 Please, note that Bitbucket Server already uses similar real-time pop-up alert messages to notify the administrator about specific system issues, like the Base URL mismatch, or the license expiry approaching.
fields.summary: As an approver, I want to be instantly notified of any comments added in the Pull Request I am viewing

fields.description:
I would like to have people in bitbucket be able to tag themselves with keywords like 'frontend' and/or 'backend', etc., so that when people want to assign their pull request they can choose e.g. 'backend' and get a drop-down of people who are tagged as such. 

Motivation is to get an easy overview of reviewers available so not always the same are put on a PR.
fields.summary: People tagged by keywords to choose from a pool of reviewers via keyword e.g. 'backend'

fields.description:
When integrating Bitbucket with a strong-authentication (2FA) frontend proxy, we crossed an interesting wonder as to how can we do  strong-authentication with SourceTree/GIT clients.

The suggestion here is to have a global system configuration that would require REST/SCM HTTPS services to use the user's personal access tokens, and reject user passwords.

This would nudge users away from hard-coding their corporate passwords in clear-text files, and instead resort to personal access tokens and usage awareness.
fields.summary: Allow for enforcement of personal access tokens for HTTPS REST/GIT calls.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a Jira issue is created from a Pull Request in Bitbucket, value "None" for the Security Level is not available for selection.

h3. Environment

* Bitbucket integrated with Jira
* Tested with Bitbucket version 5.8.2 and Jira version 7.13 (also affecting integration with Jira 7.5.0)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Jira:*

# Create a Issue Security Scheme
# Set security levels (e.g., 3 different levels) and set application access (e.g., any logged in user)
# Select any project and apply the security scheme to its Issue Security settings

*Bitbucket:*

# Create a Pull Requests
# Add a new comment
# From the comment, click on Create JIRA issue
# Select the project and issue type

h3. Expected Results

If an issue is created directly in Jira, it is possible to select the 3 different security levels configured above, and also option *None*. This option (*None*) should be available for selection as well when the issue is created from Bitbucket.

h3. Actual Results

Value *None* is missing from the issue creation screen when the issue is created from Bitbucket.

h3.Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Value None missing from issue creation dialog
For BitBucket Cloud, enable to add description or tagging for restricted IP addresses in Team Settings => Access Control => IP Whitelisting .

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce

# Create a pull request and merge it, ticking the 'Delete source branch' checkbox
# Merge pull request, but due to other unrelated issues the merge takes a long time to complete. The browser shows the red box to indicate that the request timed out.
# Merge eventually succeeds and the pull request reflects the updated state after page load

h2. Expected outcome
Source branch is also deleted

h2. Actual outcome
Source branch is not deleted

h2. Cause
The source branch deletion is triggered by javascript, which waits for the merge request to succeed on the front end before firing off another request to delete the branch. Since the request to merge timed out, the branch deletion does not get triggered.
fields.summary: Pull request source branch is not deleted if merge times out but eventually succeeds.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary
In a Bitbucket instance linked to Jira Data Center with two or more nodes, transitioning an issue from its preview - for example, when clicking an issue key mentioned in a commit message - may return a failure even though the issue was transitioned accordingly.

This happens because Bitbucket validates whether the transition was successful by searching for the issue in Jira with a subsequent request, and in Data Center, this request may arrive at a different node because, as a design decision, we don't implement session stickiness for these interactions. If that happens, it's possible that a stale result will be returned because of the way indexes are replicated in Jira Data Center - see [Keeping Lucene Index Synchronised in JIRA Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/keeping-lucene-index-synchronised-in-jira-data-center-800694054.html].

h3. Expected Behavior
Validate the transition result based on the return of the first request. This should be reliable as per [JRASERVER-33909|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33909].

h3. Actual Behavior
We don't check the return of the transition request and rely on a subsequent query that may return an inaccurate result. This sometimes causes Bitbucket to incorrectly report the transition failed with an error message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect a Bitbucket instance to a Jira Data Center installation with two or more nodes and a load balancer configured - we found this to be most reliably reproduced with AWS' ELB;
# Commit to a repository in said Bitbucket instance mentioning an existing issue key in the connected Jira installation;
# In Bitbucket, locate the commit and click the link of the issue mentioned in it;
# Attempt to transition the issue to any status. You may have to do so a number of times;
# At some point you may get an error similar to the below:
!bitbucket-transition-error.png|thumbnail!
(i) _*Message:* "The transition could not be completed due to an unexpected error. Use Jira to execute this transition"_

h3. Workaround
There are no known workarounds at this time.
fields.summary: Transitioning a Jira issue from Bitbucket may incorrectly return an error

fields.description: When reviewing code, sometimes it's difficult to know what a method's parameters are, especially if they are numbers and booleans.  It would be helpful if you could hover over a method and see the declaration or perhaps the whole method.
fields.summary: Show method declarations when hovering over a method call

fields.description:
In quite a few languages there are package managers involved which produce a lock file, which in some/most languages you might want to commit to the repository.

These files are generally very large and as such will cause a PR to not render most of the relevant changes (click to open).

Mostly these files reside in the root directory, but currently changes in PRs are ordered alphabetically, rather than first folders, then files, alphabetically.

If we would order the changes as suggested in this issue, the issue with these lock files causing the most essential changes in the PR not to render would be less of a problem.

=====

Alternatively I suggest to change the methodology used to count the amount of changes displayed in a PR; if a given file is too large to render, it should not be rendered but the line count should also not be added to the amount of rendered lines.

This way, while the first file of a PR might be to large to render, all others after that one might not be and still render.
fields.summary: Pull request file order: first folders, then files

fields.description:
I would like to be able to:

Paste an image from the clipboard into the Issue editor

instead of having to:

Save said image, browse, select, upload image.
fields.summary: Paste image from clipboard into Issue editor

fields.description: Currently, the users' list only shows them sorted by name alphabetically. It would be nice to sort them by the fields that are currently visible (username, email, directory, last authenticated).
fields.summary: Sort Users by different fields in the UI

fields.description: Bitbucket sends emails whenever action is taken on a pull request. Unlike GitHub, these emails are lacking a List-Id header. As such they wind up in my inbox instead of filed away.
fields.summary: Bitbucket PR emails should send a List-Id header that includes the project and repo

fields.description:
We would like to have ability to disable merges on project/repository level.

This will help to keep history clean/linear and will simplify Git client configuration for many teams migrating from SVN.
fields.summary: Ability to disable merge commits
MVC 5 Tutorials

fields.description:
Problem Definition: Currently there's no way to send e-mail communications to users that are set as Licensed users in Bitbucket; this would be useful for example to communicate to all users about service outages.

Suggested Solution: Include a section in UI to let Bitbucket administrators send out e-mail notifications to all Bitbucket licensed users.
fields.summary: Email communication to Licensed Bitbucket users

fields.description: The current setup is, when you set a three day expiration, on Monday you can't find artifacts for builds from Friday anymore. I'd like a setting to set Expiry to "3 Workdays" and it won't count Saturdays+Sundays.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Expiry days counts workdays not calendar days

fields.description:
I know it's been a while since this suggestion was first raised (in BSERV-4274) and I'm not sure why it's marked as resolved because the functionality doesn't exist but I think this would still (4 years later) be a great addition to the PR workflow.

 

As a reviewer, I don't have the ability to mark an individual file to say, "Yes, I've reviewed the changes to this file and I'm happy with them to go to our Production environment". I know that when a change to the file is committed it is shown in *bold* styling in the PR diff file tree but this disappears after clicking it once and then if you come back to the pull request at a later date, you're not sure whether you finished reviewing and approved that file or not.

 

If a pull request has 50 file changes and I have been reviewing them one by one I'd like to check off the ones I've completed reviewing. For example, if a particular file has a one line change in it and it hasn't been changed again since I first reviewed it, I'd like to forget about that file as I know it has been approved. On the flip side, if a new commit was pushed which contained changes to a previously 'Approved' file, the green 'tick' next to the file in the diff tree would be automatically removed prompting me to review that individual file again.
fields.summary: Add the ability to mark individual files as Reviewed or Needs Work

fields.description:
It would be nice if the autogenerated emails that Bitbucket sends contained metadata in the email headers.
I would like to apply filtering to these emails to focus on the updates I care about most (e.g. new comments on PRs I created?)
So I'd like to request email headers containing
- project name (repo name)
- branch name
- person who created the pull request
- current state of the PR (needs work? approved? declined?)
fields.summary: Bitbucket pull request update emails should have headers for project, branch name, pull request creator, PR state

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:

Data Center customers have an expectation of availability for their server instances. Often in these large data center environments, users are programmatically created or provisioned from directory systems. However, when the license count is exceeded, users can still continually be created. This is a problem, because once the license count is exceeded the server becomes Read-Only and is no longer available for any real use. This action negates the feature of high availability, since no work can be done on it.
h3. Suggested Solution:

No longer allow the creation of any new users that exceed the license limit, and keep the server from being made Read-Only.
h3. Why this is needed:

Keeping the license count from being exceeded in order to maintain high availability of the server for all existing users requires constant vigilance for some teams.
fields.summary: Exceeding license limit should not render the server Read-Only for Data Center

h3. Summary
In-browser editing hangs on the commit dialog with JS error if the commit was rejected by a pre-commit hook with _RepositoryHookVetoedException_

The issue can be reproduced with  [External Hooks|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211631/external-hooks?hosting=server&tab=overview] with no error in the user interface.

By the same time in console client, the whole procedure is going well and generating correct RepositoryHookVetoedException.



h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
Currently, diff transcoding can be enabled and disabled on a per-repository basis. In [Using diff transcoding in Bitbucket Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/using-diff-transcoding-in-bitbucket-server-776640069.html] we describe that enabling this feature has implications for performance.

*Problem*

If users enable diff transcoding for their repositories performance of the server may suffer, and the admin has no way of disabling diff transcoding except by disabling it on all repositories one by one.

*Expected solution*

An administrator should have a way of disabling diff transcoding on a global level.
fields.summary: As an administrator I want to globally disable diff transcoding to avoid performance problems

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

AWS Aurora ([https://aws.amazon.com/rds/aurora/details/postgresql-details/)] is not mentioned as a supported database in [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/supported-platforms-776640981.html].
h3. Suggested Solution

Add this to test matrix and support.
h3. Workaround

Use alternate RDBMS solutions which are supported.
fields.summary: Add support for AWS Aurora (PostgresSQL compatible edition)

fields.description:
When [auto-merge|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/automatic-branch-merging-776639993.html] fails with a merge conflict, a Pull Request is created

Unfortunately, there is not any way to choose to attach default reviewers to attach to the review, which has resulted in issues with specific workflows and interaction with the Default Reviewers feature

Please give us a way to enable default reviewers on auto-merge failures
fields.summary: Feature to enable default reviewers in Pull Requests created by auto-merge failure

fields.description:
h2.Problem

When starting Bitbucket Server using the startup script, the following dialog is displayed:

{panel}
Starting Bitbucket webapp at http://localhost:7990\\ The Bitbucket webapp has been started.

If you cannot access Bitbucket within 3 minutes, or encounter other issues, check the troubleshooting guide at:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Troubleshooting+Installation
{panel}

However {{https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Troubleshooting+Installation}} has been changed to {{https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Troubleshooting+Bitbucket+Server+installations}} so going to the first URL results in a "Page Not Found"


h2. Proposed Solution 

Update the appropriate scripts, eg _start-webapp.bat, _start-webapp.sh with the correct URL
fields.summary: The startup dialog mentions "https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Troubleshooting+Installation" which has been changed and results in a "Page Not Found"

fields.description:
Problem Definition: Users are not warned prior to the session timeout. 

Suggested Solution: Include a warning banner prior to session timeout so that the user can take action.
fields.summary: Warning banner available prior to session timeout

fields.description:
It would be great if we had the choice to pick the protocol in the instructions to resolve merge conflicts. While the example provided is nice it does not fit the needs of customer the only allow ssh connections to Bitbucket. If we could choose the protocol and select ssh. This would help start resolving the merge conflict faster.

Currently, the instructions for resolving a merge conflict are only presented using https.
fields.summary: The ability to choose protocol for instructions to resolving Merge Conflicts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There are various scenarios for this:
 - migration to new sites keeping the older one active while removing the possibility to update it
 - maintenance activities when Bitbucket can be accessible but no changes (in the configuration or in the database) should occur

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a read-only mode for Bitbucket.
h3. Workaround

+Disable SCM access for both HTTP(S) and SSH and in browser file editing+

Disable SCM access for both HTTP(S) and SSH, as well as disabling file editing in Bitbucket Server itself. This will prevent users from updating content in repositories, however note that disabling SCM access will also disable the ability to clone.
 # Disable SCM access on the admin's Server Settings page
 !https://content.screencast.com/media/e6841ebd-0484-45e5-9495-5d88921885a6_293c3d78-bf1d-4d51-becd-e53646a12bfd_static_0_0_2018-09-20_09-14-03.png!
 Cloning prevented:
{noformat}
  $ git clone ssh://git@example.com:7999/proj/repo.git 
  Cloning into 'repo'...
  ssh: connect to host example.com port 7999: Connection refused
  fatal: Could not read from remote repository.Please make sure you have the correct access rights
  and the repository exists.
  
  $ git clone http://example.com:7990/bitbucket/scm/proj/repo.git
  Cloning into 'repo'...
  Username for 'http://example.com:7990': admin
  Password for 'http://admin@example.com:7990':
  fatal: remote error: SCM access over HTTP(S) has been disabled
  SCM access over HTTP(S) has been disabled {noformat}
Pushing prevented:
{noformat}
  [/repo]$ git push
  fatal: remote error: SCM access over HTTP(S) has been disabled
  SCM access over HTTP(S) has been disabled 
  {noformat}
 # Editing files in the browser would still work, but that can be disabled by setting the system property {{feature.file.editor}} to {{false}} (see [Bitbucket Server config properties documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-config-properties-776640155.html]).

Any other changes (e.g. pull request creation, permission changes or any administrative settings) will not be blocked.

h3. Alternative workarounds

Depending on your goal, you could also use one of these workarounds:

+Remove write permissions using REST API endpoints+
 In this way, commit pushes to repositories and projects can be prevented but it will still be possible to create pull requests unless we completely remove the access (including the read-only one) to the repositories. Any other system changes (e.g. user directories, add on installation) cannot be prevented.

+DNS rules update+
 At the DNS level, the traffic can be directed to static page indicating to the users that Bitbucket is not accessible and where to go instead (e.g. the URL of the new instance) In this case, both HTTP and SSH access has to be blocked as per above.
fields.summary: Allow to switch Bitbucket to read-only mode

fields.description:
If you launch a new mirror and tried a clone, the mirror passes health check but returns an error to the client.

The mirror shouldn't consider itself "healthy" to return an error when it obviously knows it cannot handle clone requests associated with repos it hasn't finished syncing. Can you make the mirror perform a just-in-time fetch from the primary or mark itself unhealthy so no traffic is routed to it?
fields.summary: Mirrors return errors back to the client if they are still syncing. Can the mirror mark itself unhealthy so no traffic is routed to it?
Rest appi

fields.description:
When I view Bitbucket dashboard, the right-hand side column shows a list of "recently viewed" repositories. I find this of limited use because during the course of work I may visit more repositories than fit the list, and this pushes the ones I am most interested in off the list.

It would be more useful to have the ability *to mark the repository as "favorite"*, and then *to view all such repositories as a list*. Two obvious places where "favorite" repositories could be displayed are 1) in the "dashboard", in the right (Repositories) column above the "recently viewed" list, and 2) in the "profile", in a separate tab next to "Repositories" tab.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to mark a repository as "favorite" and display a list of favorite repositories.

fields.description:
*Description*
 When using Diff view for a pull request, a newline symbol is displayed as being present in file version when it is not in the file. This new line symbol is faintly colored gray which makes it difficult to view it. 

*Suggestions*
 # There should be no new line at the end of a file version, where the file has no such new line.
 # The color of the white space symbol should be more visible for easy view. A more visible color should be used in the place of the light grey color.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Create a pull request where a text file is added where that file's last line does not end with a newline.
 i.e. # *{{echo -n "hello" > hello.txt}}*
 # Update the pull request by  adding a newline of text, to the end of the file.

*Expected Result*
 There should be no new line at the end of a file version of the Diff view with show whitspace differences active

*Actual Result*
 With "show whitspace differences" active, you will see that both the original and the updated version show a newline.

The image below show the new line added.

!image.png!
fields.summary: The "show whitespace characters" of Diff view shows a new line symbol when no new line is present

fields.description:

The current layout may be confusing to the users that are accustomed to the previous layout.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
An image file in a preview of markdown file isn't rendered by Bitbucket Server when the repository uses Git LFS.

h3. Environment
* Enable Git-LFS
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Git-LFS
# Create a markdown file, which has a link to the image file
# Track image files(jpg) as LFS files
# commit the markdown file and push to Bitbucket server

h3. Expected Results
An image file is rendered in markdown preview.

h3. Actual Results
An image file is not rendered in markdown preview.
Bitbucket Server doesn’t render/preview as the image, which image is tracked by Git LFS
 !git-lfs-not-render-image.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
no workaround
fields.summary: An image file in a preview of markdown file isn't rendered by Bitbucket Server when the repository uses Git LFS

On the Merge Checks settings page for Projects: <Base URL>/projects/<Project-key>/settings/merge-checks -- when clicking the '*Learn more about merge checks*.' link, it links to the wrong URL, causing it to show an error 404

See screenshot:

fields.description:
It happend to me a lot lately that I created a new branch coming from a Jira ticket, that was based on the wrong branch. This happend because I am working on features based on a release branch, not from master.

Therefore I would really like a possibility to set a custom base branch for my user, so every branch I create, is automatically created from this base branch.

This would be a quite useful feature for all members of our team and possibly other to.
fields.summary: Possibility to set "Base working branch" per user.

fields.description:
As a pull request author, there are times when I find that my PR needs additional work before it can be merged.

Reviewers can mark a PR as "needs work" however a PR author cannot. It would be good if a PR author could do this.
fields.summary: Allow pull request author to mark PR as "needs work"

fields.description:
We can configure pull requests to require a certain number of approvals.  That helps a bit.  However, we could use a little more flexibility.

I can also mark the PR as "needs work", but that is just advisory, so it's somewhat pointless.

I want to be able to define that certain people, when they mark something as "needs work", then that PR cannot be merged until the PR changes state.  I'd have to accept that it would be reset when new changes are pushed (as if that reviewer never gets back to the PR, then it could never be merged).  It would have to be clear that the PR is not mergeable because of the disapproval from that reviewer.  This feels like something that would be configured in "Workzone".
fields.summary: Allow specifying "binding disapprovals" that will block merge until reset

fields.description:
Right now, if you merge using the rest API, the default merge strategy will be used.  While this is a sensible default, it would be great if you could select other merge strategies allowed by the repo.

We use custom toolting to merge PRs that integrates with other internal tools.  We use a rebase workflow.  This is normally fine, but sometimes there are long-running branches with multiple merges, and the rebase becomes too expensive to perform manually.  In these cases, our developers must used the web interface the merge, giving up all the advantages of our custom tooling.
fields.summary: Allow setting the merge strategy via the REST API

fields.description:
To delete objects in Bitbucket Cloud, you use the web interface

[https://wac-cdn.atlassian.com/dam/jcr:46218516-f4aa-490a-9afc-c36ca863c98f/09.png?cdnVersion=jx]

 

Whereas for Bitbucket Server,
{quote} # To remove Git LFS objects from a repository, delete and recreate the repository. When you delete a repository, any associated issue key and forks are also deleted.{quote}
[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Delete-Git-LFS-files/qaq-p/863172]

 

This is a terrible way to manage Git LFS objects. It would be better to have the same sort of interface that Bitbucket Cloud already has.
fields.summary: Manage LFS objects

fields.description:
Original request:  [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Group-Membership-list/qaq-p/891013?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_answer&utm_content=topic]

SHORTER VERSION

============

This is a HUGE problem every repo effectively has to have everybody added manually because we do not have a simple means to answer these questions

Average (non-admin) user need to be able to determine:

1) Please show a list of [security] group names.

2) Please show a membership list for Group (NAME)

3) Who is the OWNER or MANAGER or ADMIN of Group(NAME) [So I can request membership]

4) Person (X) has access, Person (Y) needs access (effectively Person(Y) needs to be added to some Group(NAME) - but I don't know who owns the group. I don't know if it is the correct group or not, Having answers to (1/2/3) above would solve this.

5) Given User (X) - Please show a list of Groups they belong to.   Note that I also am members of various groups - Please indicate perhaps in BOLD text - groups that both (User(X) and MYSELF) belong to.

============

This is a *HUGE* problem for our team - it happens often, every time somebody moves across projects, or a new person comes or a person exits - They do not have access to projects, we want to grant access via GROUPs but Groups are sort of useless.

This is not a BITBUCKET or JIRA administrator level request - this is for an AVERAGE user.

This is *NOT* a request for an Administrator - an AVERAGE user should be able to get to this.

What i describe here is what I saw at a previous employer- they used this method to join various GROUPs - Access to things could be granted via specific user NAME or By way of GROUP name.  The GROUP name also served as a mailing list name. It was VERY helpful and VERY useful.

Effectively "the name" - aka; Group name or in their case "mailing list name" - became the security group name - which could be use just about anywhere.

======

I want three things - this is for JIRA and BITBUCKET and CONFLUENCE

As a *NON*ADMIN* user - I should be able to - and need this feature:

*REQUEST (A)* you have today a LIST OF PEOPLE - with mug shots. (BTW - This is really hard to find, it should be easy to find)

What is MISSING and I want you to add is a list of GROUPS the person belongs to.

When displaying the list of groups -

OPTION 1 - show them in TWO lists:  (Group 1) groups that we SHARE in common (I belong and they belong) and (Group 2) list of groups that they belong to, and I do not belong to.

OR - OPTION 2 - Lists the groups in multiple columns - IF that person AND myself BOTH belong to the same group THEN show the group name in BOLD,  ELSE show the group name in NORMAL text.

I should be able to CLICK on any group and see the details of the group.

*REQUEST (B)* What is MISSING is a means to LIST OF GROUPS with descriptions.

(This should be right below or next to the VIEW PEOPLE item)

 

This can be shown in two ways: 

OPTION 1 - As two separate lists - (group 1) the list of groups that I belong to, and (group 2) the list of groups that I do not belong to.

OR OPTION 2 - If i am a member of that group THEN display the name in BOLD, ELSE show the group name in NORMAL.

*REQUEST (C)* When displaying a group (something you do not have)

Minimally - List the *OWNER* of the group and contact information for that person.

BETTER - It would be great if groups could be self administering.

1) A CLICK button LEAVE a group,

2) A CLICK button to JOIN a group - Some groups might be "automatic-approval"

3) A CLICK button to REQUEST (from the owner) to JOIN the group.
fields.summary: User/Group List Request

fields.description:
*Summary:*
 An improvement on the search modifiers for commits. This should make it possible to search for commits that contain specific commit message, author, email, commits after a specific date.

The modifiers suggested are;
 # Commits after a specific date. 
 # Commit comments search modifier
 # Commit author search modifier
 # Committer email search modifier
 # Date after search modifier
 # Date before search modifier

Presently commit search only supports search using a commit hash.
fields.summary: Search for specific commits using some attributes of the commit

fields.description:
When public access is enabled on a project, a {{PUBLIC}} lozenge appears next to it in the UI, and next to all the repositories under that project. When {{feature.public.access}} is set to "false" in {{bitbucket.properties}}, these projects and repositories are no longer public, but they still display this lozenge.

Reproduced in 5.12.1. The lozenge on projects did not exist as far back as 5.1.1.
fields.summary: Remove the "PUBLIC" lozenge on projects and repositories when "feature.public.access" is set to false

fields.description:
Hello!

We have Jira Server 7.10.2 and Bitbucket Server 5.11.1. When I try create branch from Jira issue, I see "Create branch" form where field "Branch type" has default value to "Custom". It would be great to be able to customize the default value for this field so that instead of "Custom" it would be, for example, " Feature".
fields.summary: Add posibility for change default value in field "Branch type" when try create branch from JIRA

fields.description:
Hello, 

We are currently looking for a way to disable extended permissions as seen [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-disable-extended-project-administration-941360076.html]

Is there any way to do it for our Bitbucket app?

Thanks
fields.summary: Disabling extended project permissions

fields.description:
In the side-by-side diff, the overview of additions is displayed near the scroll-bar on the right of the screen but overview of deletions is on the left of the screen.

See for example side-by-side diff of these changes: [https://bitbucket.org/xoseperez/fauxmoesp/diff/src/fauxmoESP.cpp?diff2=8e133caec430&at=dev]

The overview of changes in side-by-side diff is a great feature that really helps to orientate in the change-set but it's not intuitive as I have to look at two different places in order to scan through all the changes: [https://imgur.com/a/2T1ey3m]

I like the way Meld or PhpStorm IDE does it. They display all changes in the overview both on left and right: [https://imgur.com/a/mxo6O9H]
A thin line is displayed even for changes/lines that are present on the other side. This way I can scan through all changes in the file and without turning my head left and right like when watching a tennis match. :)
fields.summary: Hard to orientate in long files with side-by-side diff

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When pulling a list of users via REST API, the API ignores the first user directory in the lineup. If the user was assigned a permission in the internal (or any other) directory, then the group membership is associated with that directory.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create internal user "test" while no LDAP is connected.
# add groups "stash-users" and "stash-admin" to user "test"
# Run API call
{noformat}
$ curl -u admin -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" "https://bitbucket.mycompany.com/rest/api/1.0/admin/groups/more-members?context=stash-users&limit=1000" | jq .

{
      "name": "test",
      "emailAddress": "test@test.com",
      "id": 407,
      "displayName": "test",
      "active": true,
      "slug": "test",
      "type": "NORMAL",
      "directoryName": "Bitbucket Internal Directory",
      "deletable": true,
      "mutableDetails": true,
      "mutableGroups": true,
      "links": {
        "self": [
          {
            "href": "https://bitbucket.mycompany.com/users/test"
          }
        ]
      }
    },
{noformat}
# add Delegated LDAP with user "test" present and default group memberships=stash-users
# Verify in WebUI that Delegated LDAP is at the top of the user Directory List and that the user is listed as a "Delegated LDAP Authentication" Directory type within the "users" UI page.
# Run API call again against both "stash-users" and "stash-admin". 


h3. Expected Results

The list of users would show the external directory for the user association.

h3. Actual Results

If no login attempt was made, both groups will continue to show as internal for the user profile despite the external directory being listed first. If the user has attempted logging in, then "stash-users" will show as Delegated but stash-admin will continue to show as internal. 
 
h3.Workaround
# Edit user "test"
# Remove group "stash-admin"
# Re-add group "stash-admin"
# Run API call, see Delegated LDAP rather than internal.

*Note*
If a default group membership was not used (as mentioned in step 4), then the workaround below would have to be taken for the group "stash-users" as well.
fields.summary: REST API returns inconsistent user directory results when searching groups

fields.description:
h2. Summary

On Source View on Bitbucket Server, on the 'Filter' tab, the Search feature does not look to be working correctly. For example, from the attached image below, the only file which is expected to show is the first result, but 7 results show up instead, with 6 don't exactly match the search term

!Screen Shot 2018-09-11 at 9.53.17 PM.png|thumbnail!

The filter should show only files which match the search term exactly.
h3. Actual Results

The filter shows more files than expected from the search term
fields.summary: File Search feature on Source View Filter does not work correctly

fields.summary: It should be possible to comment inline for git commit messages

fields.description:
Please provide support to utilize HSTS headers directly from Bitbucket's container Tomcat/Springboot.

The HSTS is an IETF draft standard being developed by Google. It has a number of existing supported browsers like Firefox4 and Chrome (though I note both these are unsupported browsers). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Strict_Transport_Security

A sample HTTP configuration is here and the HTTPS would involve the same "Header Always set" directive in the Apache HTTPS virtual host (though strictly "Always" isn't required except on HTTP):
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/HTTP_Strict_Transport_Security
fields.summary: HSTS Support for Bitbucket Server

fields.description: As per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/enabling-ssh-access-to-git-repositories-in-bitbucket-server-776640358.html] key sizes have been tested for up to 8192 bytes in size. Could there be a Bitbucket property to only allow public keys of a certain minimum size?
fields.summary: Enforce Minimum SSH Public Key Size

fields.description:
The list of pull requests to be reviewed is not scrollable. The "Created" tab has a scroll bar that allows viewing the whole list of created pull requests, however the Reviewing tab has no scroll bar, leaving available only the pull requests before the window cuts off.

 

The scroll bar appears fine in 5.13.0 and 5.12.1 with testing so far, but is missing in at least 5.10.1.

Shift-click to view diff between commits in pull request

fields.description:
On almost any view inside of a Bitbucket repository a project and repository name is output in the top of the main frame. It's looking like a kind of directory listing (in HTML unordered list with the class name _repository-list_ used).

If you go into a pull request overview (URL _/pull-requests/#/overview_) you don't have this listing.

So if you switching between different tabs and go back after a while, you need to switch for example to the files view, to know which repository you are in.

Ok. At the end, also the Browser URL is telling about. But getting the repository-list inside of a pull request overview would be more comfortable.
fields.summary: Project and Repository name in pull request overview

fields.description:
h3. Summary

HTTP Clones of non-empty repositories does not result in any files or folders on the client. The clone fails silently with exit code 128.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change plugin.bitbucket-scm-cache.minimum.free.space to a value greater than free space on the cache disk (Default 5 gigs)
 # Clone via HTTP from a non-empty repository. (With git protocol v1)

h3. Expected Results

Cloned files are found on the client
h3. Actual Results

Client has no files or directories from the clone. An {{strace}} on the git command or {{echo $?}} shows that the exit code is 128
From strace:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
..
..
exit_group(128) = ?
+++ exited with 128 +++ 
{code}

h3. Notes

The below logs is shown in the atlassian-bitbucket.log file indicating that there is not enough space in the cache directory:
{noformat}
2018-09-05 00:35:54,532 WARN  [http-nio-7995-exec-3] pt @8MQ3GYx35x9x0 103.233.242.8 "POST /scm/tes/test.git/git-upload-pack HTTP/1.1" c.a.util.contentcache.ContentCache 1: Caching has been temporarily disabled because there is not enough free space on /var/atlassian/application-data/bitbucket/caches/scm/1 (2142777344 bytes free)
2018-09-05 00:35:54,576 DEBUG [http-nio-7995-exec-3] pt @8MQ3GYx35x9x0 103.233.242.8 "POST /scm/tes/test.git/git-upload-pack HTTP/1.1" c.a.bitbucket.scm.BaseCommand Executed /usr/local/git/bin/git http-backend
2018-09-05 00:35:54,607 DEBUG [http-nio-7995-exec-3] pt @8MQ3GYx35x9x0 103.233.242.8 "POST /scm/tes/test.git/git-upload-pack HTTP/1.1" c.a.bitbucket.scm.BaseCommand Executed /usr/local/git/bin/git http-backend
{noformat}
The following can also be logged:
{noformat}
2018-09-05 10:59:23,804 INFO  [io-pump:thread-8] admin @1HCUNRCx659x12x0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 "POST /scm/test/test.git/git-upload-pack HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.w.filters.StreamGuardFilter The remote client has aborted the connection{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Increase free disk space to greater than 5 gigs
 # Use SSH to clone the repository.
 # Set plugin.bitbucket-scm-cache.minimum.free.space to a value lower than the free space available
fields.summary: HTTP Git Clone seems to complete, but local directory is missing when scm caches do not have enough free space on disk

fields.description:
h3. Problem
https://s3.amazonaws.com/quickstart-reference/atlassian/bitbucket/latest/doc/bitbucket-data-center-on-the-aws-cloud.pdf mentions a Catalina Opts field that passes JVM parameters, such Xms and Xmx to the Bitbucket JVM prior to startup.

Since Bitbucket Server 5.x we have moved away from Catalina so this field is no longer useful.

For 5.x instances, how can the Xmx & Xms be modified when the instance is being provisioned?

h3. Proposed solution
Add a new field to the template that can set the JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY & JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY environment variables that the _start-webapp.sh script looks for so the max and min heap can be modified during instantiation.
fields.summary: As a user I'd like to set the Xmx value in a data center node that is provisioned via the quickstart template

fields.description:
On the pull requests dashboard, we can see if a reviewer approved the pull request, but we can't see if the author approved it. 

There should have been a green mark on the author profil picture if she/he approved it.
fields.summary: Show author approval on the pull requests dashboard

fields.description:
We would like to see better logging for issues regarding NTP. 
After rebooting a Mirror it would not connect back the upstream cluster.
This was the error:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"POST /rest/mirroring/latest/upstreamServers/b5f0e586-7d67-3f36-8a4c-833cc11effa1/addon/events HTTP/1.1" c.a.b.i.m.m.c.DefaultServerUpstreamClient Delegated authentication failed because the upstream rejected our mirror credentials. Perhaps the mirror has been disabled on the upstream? 
{code}
The cause was that the Mirror needed to be synced with the NTP server.
fields.summary: Better Logging for NTP sync or time related issues

fields.description:
Hi,
 I see there were a lot of issues about it but I didn't find an official solution.

We are in the progress of moving to Bitbucket data center and we encountered a problem with publishing to artifactory and using other tools...

Jenkins currently pulls and clones the code via the slugs and creates the project folder in lower case while the repo name is case insensitive

We have 150 repos that we are migrating from our old VCS and all of our Artifactory management, whitesource and other tools managed the results of the builds with insensitive casing, now we will have to work around the casing problem to avoid creating separate result sets for the same repositories that we had in the previous VCS and Bitbucket.

e.g -> Artifcats for build were published for repo named "MyRepo" in the old VCS.
now they are published to "myrepo"...
Whitesource scan results are now published to "myrepo" instead to "MyRepo".



This is an important feature, on one hand Bitbucket is an easy platform to manage code and integrate it with CI/CD tools on the other hand migrating to bitbucket with existing resources that doesn't fit Bitbucket's lowercase restriction makes it really hard...
fields.summary: slug should be case sensitive or configurable

Hi,

I have configured Bitbucket Server to work with Jenkins by enabling a Webhook in Bitbucket with the Jenkins URL and the event being - Pull request approved. So I want a build on Jenkins to be triggered when a pull request is approved by the named reviewer.

The Jenkins job is configured to be triggered remotely using a token and that token is specified in the Bitbucket Webhook along with the Jenkins URL. This is working as expected. The Jenkins job is triggered automatically as soon as the pull request is approved by the reviewer.

But, I have also configured a merge check for the project . The merge check is enabled for minimum successful builds and the number of builds to be successful is configured to be 1. So, I expect the merge button to be enabled as the reviewer has approved the pull request and the Jenkins build has run (also success). But unfortunately, the merge button is not enabled even after all this. I also triggered a build manually on the same commit ( was success too ) but with no success on the merge button being enabled. Please help me out. Thanks.

fields.description:
{panel}
*Details about the fix for this issue*

Starting from Bitbucket 5.+, the application components leading to this problem have been refactored to prevent similar conditions to occur in the future.

{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In some rare conditions only occurring the startup, when the TagService in a cluster node receives a RepositoryRefsChangedEvent before the ScmService startup completed, the node will not startup properly.

Other nodes started afterwards may be non functional.

h3. Suggested Solution
Harden the management of such events at startup.

h3. Workaround
- Monitor the logs to make sure that the following is not reported:
{noformat}
c.a.s.i.c.StateTransferringExecutor Error while processing asynchronous task
com.atlassian.bitbucket.scm.UnsupportedScmException: bitbucket.scm.unsupported[git]
{noformat}
-- If found, restart the affected node.
fields.summary: Hardening of the management of events on startup before the ScmService is fully started

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Deleting a repository from Bitbucket does not remove the {{$BITBUCKET_HOME/caches/scm/<repo_id>}} folder.

This can lead to situations where the operating system will not allow the creation of new folders in the {{caches/scm}} folder with the effect that any subsequent clone of a new repository (which would require a new folder to be created) will fail.

If the number of folders exceeds the allowed numbers of subfolders, the following error will be added to the logs:
{noformat}
SSH - git-upload-pack '/<project>/<repository_name>.git' c.a.b.i.ssh.server.SshCommandAdapter Error encountered while handling SSH command 'git-upload-pack '/<project>/<repository_name>'': Failed to create cache directory at: {} [/$BITBUCKET_HOME/caches/scm/<repository_id>]
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
Delete the folders containing the cache-entries when a repository is deleted.

h3. Workaround
Restart Bitbucket. A restart will delete all cache-entries and their corresponding folders.
fields.summary: When a repository is deleted, delete the caches/scm folder and not just the cache entries

fields.description:
Our security team has asked us to implement MFA on bitbucket, which we have done on the from end via a SAML/SSO plugin, however, the actual git methods to access the repos still is only single factor via SSH keys and Personal Access tokens.  I understand that this is generally a limitation on git functionality and so does my IT folks.

However, the issue with the SSH leys and PATs is that they are unlimited duration and should they be compromised, there is nothing that at least expires their value after some point of time.  It ould be nice to be able to have a feature that would allow some type of PAT expiration policy(s) be assigned on the system that would force the renewal by users of these tokens.  Probably based on a configured number of days for example.
fields.summary: Personal Access Token expiration policies

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of November 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Thank you for voting on this suggestion.

I'm happy to inform you all that starting with *Bitbucket Data Center 7.0* we provide support of load-balanced AD/LDAP servers.

Cheers,
Anton Genkin
Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Bitbucket Server / Data Center does not currently support connecting to load-balanced AD servers.

Synchronising between AD servers is not supported. Microsoft Active Directory does not replicate the uSNChanged attribute across instances. For that reason, we do not support connecting to different AD servers for synchronisation.

Many companies have a single DNS entry (mydomain.mycompany.com) that points to a load balancer that directs traffic to one of many directory servers. (Or, some companies might use DNS round robin.) However, neither the use of DNS round robin nor use of an actual load balancer is supported by Bitbucket – both approaches to load balancing direct traffic to different servers, which would lead to the synchronization of a not replicated uSNChanged attribute.
Currently, Bitbucket only supports connecting to a single directory server, not different (load-balanced) servers.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for load-balanced LDAP/AD.
h3. Note

This is dependent on CWD-2783
h3. Workaround
 # Switch to a delegated user directory
 # Connect to a single LDAP server
fields.summary: Support load-balanced LDAP/AD servers with Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When re-declining a pull request, the decline fails and the user is request to refresh the page before proceeding. 



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Starting from an open pull request (existing or just created)
# Decline the pull request
# Re-open the pull request
# Decline the pull request

h3. Expected Results
The pull request can be declined.

h3. Actual Results
The pull request cannot be declined unless the page is refreshed first.

No errors or warnings are added to the logs.

The users will be presented with the following error message:
!BSERV11108_declineError.png|width=400px! 
 
h3. Notes
In earlier versions of Bitbucket (5.7.1 for example), the second decline would still fail but no error was presented to the user.

The browser console was showing an error and the following message was visible in the response:
{code:java}
{"errors":
 [{"context":null,"message":"You are attempting to modify a pull request based on out-of-date information.","exceptionName":"com.atlassian.bitbucket.pull.PullRequestOutOfDateException","currentVersion":14,"expectedVersion":12,"pullRequest":
    {"id":8,"version":14,"title":"feature/testing_branch2 to master","state":"OPEN","open":true,"closed":false,"createdDate":1519366304905,"updatedDate":1535354082996
 ...
{code}

h3.Workaround
Refresh the page. This can be done:
- before requesting the decline
- after requesting the decline and being presented with the error
fields.summary: Declining a Pull Request for the second time in a row throws "You are attempting to modify a pull request based on out-of-date information."

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
[Bitbucket Server config properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-config-properties-776640155.html] documents using {{oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver}}, which has been deprecated by Oracle. The system, and the documentation, should be updated to reference {{oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver}}, the documented replacement:

{quote}
Desupport of oracle.jdbc.driver 
In the initial release of the Oracle JDBC drivers customers were 
advised to use the classes defined in the package 
oracle.jdbc.driver. This has caused problems for customers and for 
Oracle. In Oracle JDBC release 9.0.1 customer use of the classes 
in that package was deprecated. A new package, oracle.jdbc, was 
introduced and customers were advised to begin using the 
interfaces and classes defined in oracle.jdbc. In every release 
since 9.0.1 we have encouraged customers to switch to oracle.jdbc 
and stated that oracle.jdbc.driver would be desupported. The time 
has come. Customer code that references oracle.jdbc.driver will 
not compile and will not execute in this and future releases of 
the Oracle JDBC drivers. Please use oracle.jdbc instead.
{quote}

(Quote is from [here|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/111070-readme-083278.html].)

h3. Suggested Solution
* Update the driver Class to {{oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver}} in the Database/jdbc.driver section.
* Update the system to use {{oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver}} during migration
* Update the system to detect the legacy {{o.j.d.OracleDriver}} class and automatically switch to {{o.j.OracleDriver}} at runtime
fields.summary: Database migration uses the "deprecated" o.j.d.OracleDriver

fields.summary: Automatically Detect/Suggest the target branch of a PR

fields.description:
In Bitbucket, if utilizing auto forwarding, the system will create a PR if the change does not autoforward cleanly all the way through downstream branches.

Unfortunately, the user will only discover that conflict if they go into their watch list and see the new PR (tracking the merge failure). Ideally, it will warn/notify the user during the time of merge. If the user does not return to the watch list after merging a PR, they may not know there was a merge failure.

Email notifications do help mitigate that scenario, but real time updates while merging seems like the best time to bring that to the user’s attention. Similar to the warning that is presented if a PR does not merge cleanly with a target Bbranch.

If there are better strategies for surfacing this information, I’m interested in alternative solutions.
fields.summary: Notify the user in the original PR if a change does not automerge successfully

fields.description: When Bitbucket Server starts, if any invalid {{syntax.highlighter.}} lines are found in {{bitbucket.properties}}, the entire server fails to start due to an unhandled {{StringIndexOutOfBoundsException}}. The system should detect invalid highlighters and log them, but it should still come up.
fields.summary: Invalid syntax highlighter configuration prevents the entire system from starting

fields.description:
For larger PRs, it's often helpful to give reviewers subtasks they can work on (e.g. focus on this area of code, check the behavior under conditions XYZ, etc.), so it's not up to every single reviewer to review every inch of the changeset.

Currently, the easiest way to do that is with tasks. However, when a reviewer sees open tasks, they may assume that these tasks are for the owner, and avoid starting their review while the code is still in flux.

If there were two separate buckets of tasks, it would be much easier to tell, at a glance, whether the PR has open tasks for the owner (code may change soon) or whether the open tasks are for the reviewers.
fields.summary: Have 2 separate checklists for "reviewer tasks" and "owner tasks"
JS API request for ___

fields.description:
When a {{git}} process is started using Bitbucket Server's {{CommandBuilder}} API (which extends to all of our service APIs, since our command factory implementations use the builders), if it's running in a {{pre-receive}} hook it automatically inherits any quarantine environment. However, if one of _those_ processes kicks off a nested process in one of its pump handlers (e.g. in a {{CommandOutputHandler}}, or in a callback like {{PreRepositoryHookCommitCallback}}), that process does _not_ inherit the quarantine environment and the command will fail if it attempts to access any in-flight objects.

In 5.x, the workaround for this issue is to use the {{ScmHookDetails}} to get the environment, and then apply that environment to the builder for the nested process. However, since the environment exposes paths to repositories on disk, it's going to be removed in 6.0. That means the server needs a built-in mechanism to automatically transfer the quarantine environment to pump threads.
fields.summary: Nested git processes do not apply quarantine environment
